findings.title: RRS - Redundant Require Statement
findings.description: The contract utilizes a `require` statement within the `add` function aiming to prevent overflow errors. This redundancy could lead to extra gas costs and increased complexity without providing additional security.

findings.title: MSU - Misleading State Update
findings.description: The `removeLimits` function redundantly updates `_maxTxAmount` and `_maxWalletSize` variables with the value of `_tTotal`, which is unnecessary since these variables are already initialized during contract initialization.

findings.title: RFD - Redundant Function Declaration
findings.description: The `openTrading` function within the contract is redundant and does not serve any meaningful purpose.

findings.title: POV - Phishing Origin Vulnerability
findings.description: The contract uses tx.origin for user authentication and access control, which introduces a severe security vulnerability known as the 'identity spoofing' attack.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 have native functionality that replaces it.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that their value is initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards. The `immutable` declaration can save gas when it is defined.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure that the value of the state variable cannot be changed after it has been set.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity style guide, which can negatively impact readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L05 - Unused State Variable
findings.description: An unused state variable is a state variable that is declared in the contract, but is never used in any of the contract's functions.
